metadata.title: CVE-2024-22025 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability in Node.js has been identified, allowing for a Denial ofService (DoS) attack through resource exhaustion when using the fetch()function to retrieve content from an untrusted URL.The vulnerability stems from the fact that the fetch() function in Node.jsalways decodes Brotli, making it possible for an attacker to cause resourceexhaustion when fetching content from an untrusted URL.An attacker controlling the URL passed into fetch() can exploit thisvulnerability to exhaust memory, potentially leading to processtermination, depending on the system configuration.

criterions.comment: nodejs package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
